text:
harlem River Bridges-- Willis Avenue Bridge: The Willis Avenue (Bronx) Bridge over the harlem River. It is also known as the First Avenue (Manhattan) Bridge. View 2 shows the First Avenue approach to the bridge.
View 1: George L. Belgue  August, 1930
Credit line Imperative
view 2: P. L. Sperr  August, 1936
title: Bridges - Harlem River Bridges - Willis Avenue Bridge.

University Heights Bridge, across the Harlem River at West 207th Street (Manhattan (left) and West Fordham Road, Bronx. This is a set of 3 views taken the same day and are in a northerly direction from about

(not a dry mount item).
title: Bridges - Harlem River Bridges - University Heights Bridge.

text:
Park Ave. Bridge of the New York Central Railroad, across the Harlem River, looking towards the Bronx from Manhattan. The Manhattan approach to the Bridge is East 134th Street. This is a set of 3 views.
DDecember 16, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
(not a dry mount item).
title: Bridges - Harlem River Bridges - Park Avenue Bridge - New York Central Railroad Bridge.
